document.title: A like button that likes you back
document.description: Inspired by Josh Comeau, I've recreated a like button that delightfully animates and persists state to a database.

body.raw:
### Intallation

At its most basic level, the like button is an with two rectangles "under" a heart shaped e easing between each animation state. The first animation grows the hearts size on hover and click, and the second animation gently translates the gradients position.
Because we're building a simple blog site, let's define a single document type called Post

| Name | Type   | Description          |
| ---- | ------ | -------------------- |
| name | string | Name of the resource |
| path | string | Path to the resource |

## Installtion test

```tsx
import { allPosts } from "contentlayer/generated"

export const getStaticPaths = () => {...}

export const getStaticProps = () => {...}

export default function SinglePostPage() {...}
```

### Making it playful
